intro: Codonopsis ovata var. nervosa, commonly known as the veined codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive veined leaves. The plant produces bell-shaped, pale blue to white flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial shade, making it suitable for woodland gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate foliage and unique floral structure.
